problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have 6 different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box 
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

N_ITEMS : int = {}

decision_variables.variable_dslcode_template: nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb={}, ub={})

N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 9

x_y_positions : DSList(length = {}, elem_type = X_Y_Position)
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_box(
    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt())
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item : Item = items[i]
        pos : X_Y_Position = positions[i]
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

fit_items_in_box(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.

# --- Constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt())
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                item_i : Item = items[i]
                pos_i : X_Y_Position = positions[i]
                item_j : Item = items[j]
                pos_j : X_Y_Position = positions[j]
                
                # No overlap condition: rectangles do not overlap if one is to the left, right, above or below the other
                assert (
                    pos_i.x + item_i.width <= pos_j.x or
                    pos_j.x + item_j.width <= pos_i.x or
                    pos_i.y + item_i.height <= pos_j.y or
                    pos_j.y + item_j.height <= pos_i.y
                )

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)# -- Constraints --


def ensure_item_in_one_box(
    assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt()),
    nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= nr_used_boxes

ensure_item_in_one_box(item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)

nr_used_boxes = objective

# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt())) -> int:
    max_box = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

calculated_objective_value = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
objective = calculated_objective_value

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position)

                pos_j: X_Y_Position = x_y_positions[j]

                # We assert that at least one of these non-overlapping conditions holds
                assert (
                    pos_i.x + item_i.width <= pos_j.x or
                    pos_j.x + item_j.width <= pos_i.x or
                    pos_i.y + item_i.height <= pos_j.y or

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have 6 different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box 
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

X_Y_Position = DSRecord({"x" : DSInt(lb=0, ub=12), "y" : DSInt(lb=0, ub=5)})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 5
BOX_WIDTH : int = 12
ITEMS : DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item) = [{'name': 'item1', 'width': 4, 'height': 3}, {'name': 'item2', 'width': 1, 'height': 2}, {'name': 'item3', 'width': 5, 'height': 3}, {'name': 'item4', 'width': 4, 'height': 2}, {'name': 'item5', 'width': 1, 'height': 3}, {'name': 'item6', 'width': 5, 'height': 2}, {'name': 'item7', 'width': 9, 'height': 5}, {'name': 'item8', 'width': 3, 'height': 5}, {'name': 'item9', 'width': 5, 'height': 1}]
N_ITEMS : int = 9
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9))
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 9
x_y_positions : DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position)
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 9
N_ITEMS : int = 9
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 9
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 9


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(nr_used_boxes: int, item_box_assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)), x_y_positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position)) -> int:
    # Objective is to minimize the number of boxes used
    return nr_used_boxes

objective = calculate_objective(nr_used_boxes, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position),
    nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item: Item = items[i]
        pos: X_Y_Position = x_y_positions[i]
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]

        # Ensure item is within box boundaries
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

        # Ensure item is assigned to a valid box (only used boxes)
        assert box_id <= nr_used_boxes

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions, nr_used_boxes)

def items_do_not_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position),
    nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Check for overlaps with all other items
        for j in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if i != j:
                # Only check overlap if items are assigned to same box
                assert not (item_box_assignments[i] == item_box_assignments[j] and 
                           x_y_positions[i].x < x_y_positions[j].x + items[j].width and
                           x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width > x_y_positions[j].x and
                           x_y_positions[i].y < x_y_positions[j].y + items[j].height and
                           x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height > x_y_positions[j].y)

items_do_not_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions, nr_used_boxes)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.

# --- Constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_to_single_box(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9))
):
    # Each item is assigned to exactly one box
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert item_box_assignments[i] >= 1
        assert item_box_assignments[i] <= 9

ensure_item_assignment_to_single_box(item_box_assignments)

def ensure_position_assignment_validity(
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position)
):
    # Each item has a valid position (non-negative coordinates)
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert x_y_positions[i].x >= 0
        assert x_y_positions[i].y >= 0

ensure_position_assignment_validity(x_y_positions)

nr_used_boxes = objective

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have 6 different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box 
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assigment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.

def fit_items_in_box(
    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item : Item = items[i]
        pos : X_Y_Position = x_y_positions[i]
        box_id : int = item_box_assignments[i]

        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

        # Ensure item is placed within the positive box area
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0

fit_items_in_box(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.

# --- Constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=9, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=9, elem_type=X_Y_Position)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if item_box_assignments[i] == item_box_assignments[j]:
                pos_i : X_Y_Position = x_y_positions[i]
                pos_j : X_Y_Position = x_y_positions[j]
                item_i : Item = items[i]
                item_j : Item = items[j]
                
                # Check for non-overlapping conditions
                # If any of these is true, there is no overlap
                # If none of these is true, there is an overlap
                assert (pos_i.x + item_i.width <= pos_j.x) or \
                       (pos_j.x + item_j.width <= pos_i.x) or \
                       (pos_i.y + item_i.height <= pos_j.y) or \
                       (pos_j.y + item_j.height <= pos_i.y)

no_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)# -- Constraints --

    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)),
    nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id : int = item_box_assignments[i]
        # Ensure each item is assigned to a valid box number
        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= nr_used_boxes

ensure_item_box_assignment_valid(item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)

def compute_nr_used_boxes(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=9, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)),
    nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=9)
):
    # Ensure nr_used_boxes reflects the highest box index used
    max_box_id : int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id : int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    assert nr_used_boxes == max_box_id

compute_nr_used_boxes(item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)
